bug.short_desc: python-importanize - requires both python2 and python3

long_desc.thetext:
Hi, there is a issue in the spec with a colition in %{_bindir}
You have:
%install %py2_install rm -fr %{buildroot}%{python2_sitelib}/tests %py3_install rm -fr %{buildroot}%{python3_sitelib}/tests
And then in both packages:
%{_bindir}/%{pypi_name}
You should update your spec to something like:
%install %py2_install mv %{buildroot}/%{_bindir}/%{pypi_name} %{buildroot}/%{_bindir}/%{pypi_name}-py2
And then in the python2 subpackage: %{_bindir}/%{pypi_name}-py2
By the way, you must provide a python2 subpackage and use the python-provides macro.
See: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Python#Avoiding_collisions_between_the_python_2_and_python_3_stacks

Thanks! Have updated SPEC - as of now kept /usr/bin/script and /usr/bin/script-3 Working around error: Symlink points to BuildRoot

Right, sorry! The symlink targets don't need a directory.
ln -s %{pypi_name}-3 %{buildroot}/%{_bindir}/%{pypi_name}-%{python3_version}
